items.title: Jamaicans take shelter as Hurricane Melissa bears down as category 5 storm
items.standfirst: Landfall is not expected until Tuesday but high winds have already felled trees and caused power cuts on the islandHurricane Melissa – follow latest updates liveJamaicans have started to take shelter from Hurricane Melissa as high winds topple trees and cause power cuts before the category 5 storm makes landfall on Tuesday.The slow-moving giant, the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851, is increasing in intensity and forecast to linger over the island. Authorities fear it will unleash catastrophic flooding, landslides and extensive infrastructure damage. Continue reading...
items.content: Landfall is not expected until Tuesday but high winds have already felled trees and caused power cuts on the islandHurricane Melissa – follow latest updates liveJamaicans have started to take shelter from Hurricane Melissa as high winds topple trees and cause power cuts before the category 5 storm makes landfall on Tuesday.The slow-moving giant, the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851, is increasing in intensity and forecast to linger over the island. Authorities fear it will unleash catastrophic flooding, landslides and extensive infrastructure damage. Continue reading...

items.title: Hurricane Melissa threatens to unleash record destruction on Jamaica
items.standfirst: Brutal winds and torrential rain battered Jamaica on Monday as Hurricane Melissa, a slow-moving Category 5 storm, neared the island. Prime Minister Andrew Holness warned it could be Jamaica’s most destructive storm on record. Melissa has already killed at least four people in Haiti and the Dominican Republic.
items.content: Brutal winds and torrential rain battered Jamaica on Monday as Hurricane Melissa, a slow-moving Category 5 storm, neared the island. Prime Minister Andrew Holness warned it could be Jamaica’s most destructive storm on record. Melissa has already killed at least four people in Haiti and the Dominican Republic.

items.title: Hurricane Melissa intensifies to Category 5, threatens Jamaica with 'catastrophic' flooding
items.standfirst: Hurricane Melissa intensified to a powerful Category 5 storm Monday as forecasters warned it would cause catastrophic flash flooding, life-threatening landslides and extremely strong winds across the Caribbean
items.content: Hurricane Melissa intensified to a powerful Category 5 storm Monday as forecasters warned it would cause catastrophic flash flooding, life-threatening landslides and extremely strong winds across the Caribbean

ai_summary: Hurricane Melissa strengthened to Category 5, bringing torrential rain and flooding.
Jamaica braced for the storm, with high winds causing power outages and tree falls.
The storm is the strongest to hit Jamaica since records began in 1851.
Authorities fear catastrophic flooding, landslides, and infrastructure damage.
Rescue efforts were underway, including the dramatic rescue of a baby after a crash.

clusters.title: The 92-year-old president who never loses
clusters.neutral_headline: Cameroon President Biya Wins Eighth Term

items.title: The 92-year-old president who never loses
items.standfirst: Cameroon's Paul Biya has extended his 43-year rule by wining a heavily disputed election.
items.content: Cameroon's Paul Biya has extended his 43-year rule by wining a heavily disputed election.

items.title: Sudan's RSF overrun the army's last stronghold in the Darfur region
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, the paramilitary force RSF has ousted the Sudanese army from El-Fasher, its last stronghold in Darfur, after months of fighting. Also, Paul Biya, the world's oldest serving ruler, secured an eighth term in office on Monday, after days of protesters' clashes with security forces as opposition supporters demanded credible results. And Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara has also won a fourth term.
items.content: In tonight's edition, the paramilitary force RSF has ousted the Sudanese army from El-Fasher, its last stronghold in Darfur, after months of fighting. Also, Paul Biya, the world's oldest serving ruler, secured an eighth term in office on Monday, after days of protesters' clashes with security forces as opposition supporters demanded credible results. And Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara has also won a fourth term.

items.title: 4 dead in election-related clashes as Cameroon’s Biya wins eighth term
items.standfirst: Cameroon’s 92-year-old President Paul Biya has won a record eighth term with 53.66% of the vote.
items.content: Cameroon’s 92-year-old President Paul Biya has won a record eighth term with 53.66% of the vote.

items.title: In Cameroon, the world's oldest leader claims victory -- again
items.standfirst: 92-year- old Paul Biya, the world's oldest head of state, claims victory in a disputed election, sparking unrest across the country already grappling with violence, corruption, and political tension.
items.content: 92-year- old Paul Biya, the world's oldest head of state, claims victory in a disputed election, sparking unrest across the country already grappling with violence, corruption, and political tension.(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)

items.title: Cameroon's 92-year-old president wins controversial eighth term
items.standfirst: Paul Biya retains his title as the world's oldest head of state, in an election marred with violence and allegations of fraud.
items.content: Paul Biya retains his title as the world's oldest head of state, in an election marred with violence and allegations of fraud.

items.title: Cameroon's president re-elected at 92
items.standfirst: The world's oldest head of state, Paul #Biya, 92, extended his more than four-decade rule, securing an eighth term in #Cameroon's presidential poll - results which his rival swiftly rejected. On October 26, four people were killed in #clashes between security forces and supporters of the opposition in the economic capital Douala.
items.content: The world's oldest head of state, Paul #Biya, 92, extended his more than four-decade rule, securing an eighth term in #Cameroon's presidential poll - results which his rival swiftly rejected. On October 26, four people were killed in #clashes between security forces and supporters of the opposition in the economic capital Douala.

items.title: Cameroon re-elects world's oldest president
items.standfirst: The world's oldest president has again won the vote in Cameroon, despite violent clashes ahead of the election.
items.content: The world's oldest president has again won the vote in Cameroon, despite violent clashes ahead of the election.

ai_summary: Cameroon's President Paul Biya, 92, won an eighth term in a disputed election.
The election was marred by violence and allegations of fraud.
Four people died in clashes between security forces and opposition supporters.
Opposition supporters rejected the results, demanding credible results.
Biya's win extends his 43-year rule, making him the world's oldest head of state.

clusters.title: The ‘transvestigation’ of Brigitte Macron: how false transgender claims went viral
clusters.neutral_headline: Trial Begins for Online Harassment of Brigitte Macron

items.title: The ‘transvestigation’ of Brigitte Macron: how false transgender claims went viral
items.standfirst: As 10 defendants begin trial in Paris for allegedly cyberharassing the French First Lady, Vedika Bahl takes a look at the timeline of how unsubstantiated conspiracy theories about her gender began to circulate, how the claims exploded globally after Candace Owens got involved, and how the Macrons have pushed back with legal action.
items.content: As 10 defendants begin trial in Paris for allegedly cyberharassing the French First Lady, Vedika Bahl takes a look at the timeline of how unsubstantiated conspiracy theories about her gender began to circulate, how the claims exploded globally after Candace Owens got involved, and how the Macrons have pushed back with legal action.

items.title: Ten people go on trial in Paris accused of online harassment of Brigitte Macron
items.standfirst: Trial is latest phase in legal battle against false claim that French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel TrogneuxTen people have gone on trial in Paris charged with online harassment of Brigitte Macron – the latest phase of a legal battle on both sides of the Atlantic against the false claim that the French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel Trogneux.The president, Emmanuel Macron, and his wife filed a defamation lawsuit in the US at the end of July, in connection with a rumour amplified and repeated online that Brigitte Macron was born a man. Continue reading...
items.content: Trial is latest phase in legal battle against false claim that French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel TrogneuxTen people have gone on trial in Paris charged with online harassment of Brigitte Macron – the latest phase of a legal battle on both sides of the Atlantic against the false claim that the French first lady is a man named Jean-Michel Trogneux.The president, Emmanuel Macron, and his wife filed a defamation lawsuit in the US at the end of July, in connection with a rumour amplified and repeated online that Brigitte Macron was born a man. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Alassane Ouattara wins landslide fourth term as Ivory Coast’s president

items.title: Alassane Ouattara wins landslide fourth term as Ivory Coast’s president
items.standfirst: Low turnout said to have made for most peaceful election in years, as 83-year-old accused of clampdown on dissent wins 89.77% of voteAlassane Ouattara has been declared the winner of the presidential election in Ivory Coast by a landslide.According to provisional results announced by the Independent Electoral Commission (CIE) on Monday evening, the 83-year-old won a fourth term as head of the west African country with 89.77% or 3.75m votes. Continue reading...
items.content: Low turnout said to have made for most peaceful election in years, as 83-year-old accused of clampdown on dissent wins 89.77% of voteAlassane Ouattara has been declared the winner of the presidential election in Ivory Coast by a landslide.According to provisional results announced by the Independent Electoral Commission (CIE) on Monday evening, the 83-year-old won a fourth term as head of the west African country with 89.77% or 3.75m votes. Continue reading...

items.content: Alassane Ouattara's win is unsurprising as his biggest rivals were barred from contesting the election.

items.title: Alassane Ouattara wins Ivory Coast presidential election, according to provisional results
items.standfirst: Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara secured a fourth term on Monday, according to the provisional results of the Independent Electoral Commission. Nearly nine million voters were eligible to cast their ballots on Saturday.
items.content: Ivory Coast's President Alassane Ouattara secured a fourth term on Monday, according to the provisional results of the Independent Electoral Commission. Nearly nine million voters were eligible to cast their ballots on Saturday.

ai_summary: Alassane Ouattara won a fourth term in the Ivory Coast election.
The election excluded two main rivals.
Ouattara secured 89.77% of the vote, according to provisional results.
The election was considered peaceful due to low turnout.
Ouattara has been in power since 2011.

items.title: Amazon plans to cut 30,000 corporate jobs in response to pandemic overhiring
items.standfirst: Figure represents nearly 10% of the company’s roughly 350,000 corporate employeesAmazon is preparing to lay off tens of thousands of corporate workers, reversing its pandemic hiring spree. The cuts come months after the retail giant’s CEO warned white-collar employees their jobs could be taken by artificial intelligence.The Seattle-based technology firm is planning to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs beginning Tuesday, media outlets including Reuters and the Wall Street Journal reported, citing unnamed sources familiar with the matter, as it tries to cut costs and undo the vast recruitment drive it embarked on at the height of the coronavirus pandemic, which unleashed an extraordinary – but fleeting – surge in demand for online shopping. Continue reading...
items.content: Figure represents nearly 10% of the company’s roughly 350,000 corporate employeesAmazon is preparing to lay off tens of thousands of corporate workers, reversing its pandemic hiring spree. The cuts come months after the retail giant’s CEO warned white-collar employees their jobs could be taken by artificial intelligence.The Seattle-based technology firm is planning to cut as many as 30,000 corporate jobs beginning Tuesday, media outlets including Reuters and the Wall Street Journal reported, citing unnamed sources familiar with the matter, as it tries to cut costs and undo the vast recruitment drive it embarked on at the height of the coronavirus pandemic, which unleashed an extraordinary – but fleeting – surge in demand for online shopping. Continue reading...

items.title: Amazon Plans to Cut Corporate Jobs Across Core Departments
items.standfirst: Amazon.com Inc. plans to cut corporate jobs in several key departments, including logistics, payments, video games and the cloud-computing unit, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: Amazon.com Inc. plans to cut corporate jobs in several key departments, including logistics, payments, video games and the cloud-computing unit, according to people familiar with the matter.

ai_summary: Amazon plans to cut up to 30,000 corporate jobs.
The cuts are part of an internal restructuring.
The layoffs represent nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.
The cuts are in response to overhiring during the pandemic.
The cuts are expected to begin on Tuesday.

items.title: Exxon sues California over climate laws, alleging free speech violations
items.standfirst: Oil firm asks court to block enforcement of laws that would require disclosure of planet-heating carbon emissionsExxon, an oil firm consistently ranked among the world’s top contributors to global carbon emissions, is suing the state of California over two climate-focused state laws, arguing that the rules infringe upon the corporation’s right to free speech.The 2023 laws, known collectively as the California Climate Accountability Package, will require large companies doing business in the state to disclose both their planet-heating carbon emissions and their climate-related financial risks, or face annual penalties. Continue reading...
items.content: Oil firm asks court to block enforcement of laws that would require disclosure of planet-heating carbon emissionsExxon, an oil firm consistently ranked among the world’s top contributors to global carbon emissions, is suing the state of California over two climate-focused state laws, arguing that the rules infringe upon the corporation’s right to free speech.The 2023 laws, known collectively as the California Climate Accountability Package, will require large companies doing business in the state to disclose both their planet-heating carbon emissions and their climate-related financial risks, or face annual penalties. Continue reading...

items.title: First banker jailed over Libor interest rate rigging to sue UBS for $400m
items.standfirst: Tom Hayes claims he was ‘hand-picked scapegoat’ for the Swiss bank as it tried to avoid regulatory scrutinyTom Hayes, the first banker jailed over Libor interest rate rigging, is suing his former employer UBS for $400m (£300m), claiming he was a “hand-picked scapegoat” for the Swiss bank as it tried to avoid regulatory scrutiny.The claim, which was publicly filed in a US court in Connecticut on Monday, alleges that UBS misled US authorities and called him an “evil mastermind” behind the alleged Libor scandal, in order to protect senior executives and minimise fines. Continue reading...
items.content: Tom Hayes claims he was ‘hand-picked scapegoat’ for the Swiss bank as it tried to avoid regulatory scrutinyTom Hayes, the first banker jailed over Libor interest rate rigging, is suing his former employer UBS for $400m (£300m), claiming he was a “hand-picked scapegoat” for the Swiss bank as it tried to avoid regulatory scrutiny.The claim, which was publicly filed in a US court in Connecticut on Monday, alleges that UBS misled US authorities and called him an “evil mastermind” behind the alleged Libor scandal, in order to protect senior executives and minimise fines. Continue reading...

items.title: Lithuania accuses Belarus of 'hybrid attack' after contraband balloons shut airports
items.standfirst: Lithuania accused Belarus on Monday of a “hybrid attack” after dozens of contraband-filled balloons forced the temporary closure of two airports. The NATO and EU member said the balloons, allegedly launched by Belarusian smugglers, carried illegal cigarettes and prompted Lithuania to shut its last two border crossings with Belarus.

The NATO and EU member said the balloons, allegedly launched by Belarusian smugglers, carried illegal cigarettes and prompted Lithuania to shut its last two border crossings with Belarus.

items.standfirst: PM blames Alexander Lukashenko for not stopping ‘hybrid attacks’, which closed Vilnius airport four times last weekEurope live – latest updatesLithuania’s prime minister has authorised the shooting down of smuggling balloons that cross the border from Russia’s ally Belarus, calling them “hybrid attacks” in an echo of the term used to describe Moscow’s destabilisation efforts.Incursions by balloons carrying contraband cigarettes prompted the Nato and EU member state to close Vilnius airport four times last week and shut its border crossings with Belarus temporarily. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Argentina midterm elections seen as confidence vote for Milei's economic refoms
clusters.neutral_headline: Argentina's Milei gains ground in midterm elections

items.title: Argentina midterm elections seen as confidence vote for Milei's economic refoms
items.standfirst: Even if Argentine President Javier Milei's La Libertad Avanza party is still short of a majority in parliament after midterm elections, the self-described "anarcho-capitalist" now has more room to push ahead with radical economic reforms. Since coming to power in 2023, Milei has cut budgets for education, pensions and infrastructure and laid off tens of thousands of public sector workers. The president is also credited with lowering inflation, winning praise from US counterpart Donald Trump.
items.content: Even if Argentine President Javier Milei's La Libertad Avanza party is still short of a majority in parliament after midterm elections, the self-described "anarcho-capitalist" now has more room to push ahead with radical economic reforms. Since coming to power in 2023, Milei has cut budgets for education, pensions and infrastructure and laid off tens of thousands of public sector workers. The president is also credited with lowering inflation, winning praise from US counterpart Donald Trump.

items.title: Javier Milei hails ‘tipping point’ as his far-right party wins Argentina’s midterm elections
items.standfirst: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 99% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.8% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.7%. Continue reading...
items.content: Result falls short of giving Milei a congressional majority but surprises many analysts after series of scandalsThe party of Argentina’s far-right president, Javier Milei, has won Sunday’s midterm elections after a campaign in which Donald Trump announced a $40bn bailout for the country and made continued aid conditional on the victory of his Argentinian counterpart.With more than 99% of ballots counted, La Libertad Avanza secured 40.8% of the nationwide vote, in an election widely seen as a de facto referendum on the self-styled anarcho-capitalist’s nearly two years in power. The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, secured 31.7%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Javier Milei's party secured 40.8% of the vote in Argentina's midterm elections.
The Peronist opposition, Fuerza Patria, received 31.7% of the nationwide vote.
Milei's party remains short of a congressional majority after the election.
Milei has cut budgets and laid off public sector workers since taking office.
The election was seen as a referendum on Milei's nearly two years in power.

items.title: 'Trapped and terrified': warnings as Sudanese militia advance on Darfur city
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim they've seized the Sudanese army's last base in El Fasher, Darfur — trapping hundreds of thousands and stoking fears the country could split in two.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces claim they've seized the Sudanese army's last base in El Fasher, Darfur — trapping hundreds of thousands and stoking fears the country could split in two.(Image credit: Lynsey Addario)

items.title: Grave fears for civilians after Sudanese paramilitary claims capture of El Fasher
items.standfirst: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher, Sudan, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in the country’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...
items.content: RSF says it has seized control of army’s main base in Darfur, home to famine-stricken displacement campFears are growing for hundreds of thousands of civilians trapped in El Fasher, Sudan, after the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces said it had captured the city, which it has been besieging for more than a year in the country’s civil war.The group said on Sunday that it had seized control of the army’s main base in the city in Darfur, where famine was declared in a displacement camp last year. It then released a statement saying it had “extended control over the city of El Fasher from the grip of mercenaries and militias”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Rapid Support Forces claimed to have seized the army's main base in El Fasher.
Hundreds of thousands of civilians are trapped in El Fasher, Sudan.
Famine was declared in a displacement camp in El Fasher last year.
The RSF has been besieging El Fasher for over a year during the civil war.
The RSF stated they extended control over El Fasher.

clusters.title: Cameroon’s Paul Biya re-elected for 8th term amid protests
clusters.neutral_headline: Cameroon President Paul Biya wins eighth term

items.title: Cameroon’s Paul Biya re-elected for 8th term amid protests
items.standfirst: Cameroon’s 92-year-old president Paul Biya has been re-elected for an eighth term with 53.7% of the vote, according to the Constitutional Council. His main rival, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, who claimed victory based on his own tally, denounced the result and said civilians outside his home were fired upon. Protests erupted in several cities, leaving four people dead and over 100 arrested, as authorities banned public gatherings and dismissed allegations of fraud.
items.content: Cameroon’s 92-year-old president Paul Biya has been re-elected for an eighth term with 53.7% of the vote, according to the Constitutional Council. His main rival, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, who claimed victory based on his own tally, denounced the result and said civilians outside his home were fired upon. Protests erupted in several cities, leaving four people dead and over 100 arrested, as authorities banned public gatherings and dismissed allegations of fraud.

items.title: World’s oldest serving head of state declared winner in Cameroon election
items.standfirst: Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53.66% of vote after volatile two weeks since election when opponent claimed victoryPaul Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, has been declared the winner of Cameroon’s election, granting him an eighth term that could keep him in office until he is nearly 100.The country’s constitutional council said Biya had won 53.66% of the vote, while his former ally turned challenger, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, got 35.19%. Continue reading...
items.content: Paul Biya, 92, said to have won 53.66% of vote after volatile two weeks since election when opponent claimed victoryPaul Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, has been declared the winner of Cameroon’s election, granting him an eighth term that could keep him in office until he is nearly 100.The country’s constitutional council said Biya had won 53.66% of the vote, while his former ally turned challenger, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, got 35.19%. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Paul Biya, 92, was re-elected for an eighth term with 53.7% of the vote.
Issa Tchiroma Bakary, Biya's rival, claimed victory based on his own tally.
Protests erupted in several cities after the election results were announced.
Authorities banned public gatherings and dismissed allegations of fraud.
Four people died and over 100 were arrested during the protests.

clusters.title: Has Trump's 'peace deal' solved the Thailand-Cambodia dispute?
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump touts his peacemaking skills as Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire deal

items.title: Has Trump's 'peace deal' solved the Thailand-Cambodia dispute?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?
items.content: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?

items.title: Trump touts his peacemaking skills as Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.
items.content: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.

ai_summary: Donald Trump presided over the signing of a ceasefire agreement.
The agreement was between Thailand and Cambodia.
Trump helped mediate the ceasefire earlier this year.
The signing occurred during Trump's trip to Asia.
The deal is an enhanced ceasefire agreement.
